page.title: 14THE ECOLOGY OF RUNCORN
page.content: {3.A residential area In Thorn Road there are 28 dwellings all of which are terraced houses.There is only one tree by the roadside,there is one tree in the gardens,and no trees on the open ground.In Pear Tree Avenue there are 29 houses.These are flats,terraced and semi_detached houses.There are 5 deciduous trees,3 fir trees and a cherry tree.There are 20 gardens amongst which we found these kinds of flowers:roses,tulips,violets,marigolds lilac,primula and forget-me-nots. During our visit we saw sparrows, blackbirds,seagulls,crows and pigeons. In the open ground beyond the houses we found the following wild flowers: clover,buttercups,daisies,nettles, thistles,elderberry,brambles and vetch.
